snippet.title: Liberating Ways of Seeing - Daniel Thorson - Sunday Sit
snippet.description:
10-27-2019
Daniel Thorson
Liberating Ways of Seeing

In this week's talk, Daniel Thorson explores a framework for understanding what we are doing when we meditate and how the practice works to relieve suffering. This framework, called ‘Ways of Seeing’, offers us a sensible conceptual framework to delineate the arc of practice and how techniques function to liberate freedom.

We use this framework to explore why the contemplative path may be uniquely valuable at this time of social, political, and planetary crisis. Through practice we can go beyond blind adherence to tradition, polarized perspectives, and fundamentalism—thus allowing us to become more skillful participants in our lives, relationships, and the world.

Daniel leads a guided meditation of the most well known ‘Ways of Seeing’ within the Buddhist tradition: impermanence, suffering, and no-self. In this guided meditation we relate to these three characteristics not as fundamental truths about the universe, but as methods we can use to understand the nature of perception.
